On my "One Nation..." post, I changed the last sentence. After someone pointed out to what I had typed, I thought about it and it came out the wrong way, so I deleted it. Sorry for the trouble

“One nation, under God.” This phrase was once uttered by thousands of children without thought. Today, this one phrase is something that is splitting our nation in two. The right of our nation is telling us that it is our right to say this. The left is saying no, the government cannot tell you to say this. To be honest, I have to side with the left on this. Now before you go off and just say that I am a bleeding heart liberal, let me give you some information about myself. I am a member of the Bethlehem Missionary Baptist Church in Russellville, Alabama. I have been so for almost four years. I gave my heart to the lord on November 17, 1999. I have served as teacher and superintendent for my church. I love the lord with all of my heart and I will fight for him until he calls me home. The argument that the conservative right has been fighting is the wrong fight. According to our constitution, our government cannot endorse a specific religion. The constitution was created to give all people certain rights. After it was created, the authors of our nation seen that certain rights were not granted or protected. Thus the amendments were born. The first amendment, which states “Congress shall make no law respecting an establishment of religion, or prohibiting the free exercise thereof; or abridging the freedom of speech, or of the press; or the right of the people peaceably to assemble, and to petition the government for a redress of grievances.” protects us from someone or something inhibiting us from worshipping our lord. However, it also protects those who do not recognize the lord from persecution as well. We as a Christian people must respect the laws of the land unless a law goes against God’s law. When our authors of government created the first amendment, our country was in a different time. Churches were respected and our founding fathers observed this. The first amendment was created to prevent a church from becoming an official religion. This happened in England when Henry VIII created the Church of England. All British people were required to worship in this way. Our founding members of this country were persecuted because they did not want to worship this way. So when we won our freedom, we gave ourselves the ability to never let this happen again. So what are we to do? Technically, if our government does decide to remove “under God” from our pledge, it will not stop people from saying it. I know I will always say this and if the lord permits, when the time comes I will teach my children to say this. I am not inhibited from worshipping my lord because the government tells me that I don’t have to say this phrase. Neither is anyone else who chooses to say this. Removing school prayer doesn’t stop students from praying. The lord says to always be in prayer in heart. I can say a meaningful, silent prayer as well as I can say a meaningful prayer in front of a group of students. The lord will hear both of those prayers equally. I think our Christian brothers and sisters have forgotten that we are to be a peculiar people. The bible says that we are to be discriminated against. We are to be persecuted. We are in this world and not of this world. I am not saying to stop the fight, nor I am saying that the fight is not worth it. What I am saying is that we must be smart about this fight. We are not a Christian nation. Never has this nation stood up and claimed that we are a Christian nation. Since this country’s inception, we as a people have predominately been Christian, but that doesn’t mean that are a Christian nation by legal terms. So again, I ask, what are we to do? The key to the whole to debate is looking long term. I am not in favor of changing the constitution to make our goals more achievable. The reason is that the change would be far sighted. What helped us for 200 years and now hurting us, if changed, will help us for a short time and hurt us again. I believe the key is the vote. Our nation is built on secular laws, but can be led by Christian people. These individuals can lead us in the path of right. We can instill in our children our Christian values.
